qc.notes: 8 poses met the core set. Only one cheek close-up and a single combined under-eye close-up were provided; this reduces side-to-side confidence slightly.

skin_type.label: combination
skin_type.rationale: T-zone shows mild shine and larger-looking pores while cheeks are less shiny. No heavy overall oil or dryness is seen.

skin_tone_fitzpatrick.label: IV
skin_tone_fitzpatrick.note: Estimated from appearance in bright indirect daylight; camera and background color can shift tone slightly.

skin_age_range.rationale: Fine lines are minimal and texture is moderate mainly in the T-zone and cheeks, which aligns with late-30s skin. Limited mirrored close-ups add some uncertainty.

analysis.overview_explanation: Skin appears healthy with a combination pattern. Pores and grain are most visible on the nose and right cheek, and mottled pigmentation is present across the cheeks and jaw. Under-eye darkening is mild–moderate; redness and acne are low.

pores.rationale_plain: Medium pores are clearly visible on the nose and medial cheeks, with lighter visibility on the forehead and chin. The pattern fits a T-zone distribution with slight right cheek emphasis.
possible_causes: Genetics and natural oil output make pores look larger in the T-zone.
Warm, humid weather and urban air can increase surface shine and accentuate pore edges.
Past minor breakouts may leave pores appearing more noticeable on the cheeks.

citations.title: AI grading of enlarged pores (Dermatol Ther, 2024)

wrinkles.rationale_plain: At rest, only faint forehead lines and minimal crow’s-feet are visible. No deep folds or strong shadowing are seen.
possible_causes: Natural expression lines increase with age and sun exposure.
Temporary dehydration or squinting may make fine lines appear more noticeable.

pigmentation.rationale_plain: Mottled tan macules are visible over both cheeks and along the jaw with softer contrast elsewhere. The pattern is scattered rather than confluent patches.
possible_causes: Cumulative sun exposure in a high-UV environment can lead to mottled pigmentation over time.
Marks after minor blemishes can persist for months before fading.
Heat and visible light exposure can also contribute to lingering color change.

redness.rationale_plain: There is faint central facial redness around the nose and medial cheeks without diffuse spread. No obvious visible vessels are seen.
possible_causes: Heat, exercise, and skincare actives can temporarily increase blood flow and redness.
Areas with more active pores often look slightly redder.

texture.rationale_plain: Fine grain and unevenness are notable on the medial cheeks and nose; forehead and chin are smoother. No flaking is visible.
possible_causes: Larger-looking pores and prior minor breakouts can leave a more textured surface.
Environmental dust/pollution may settle on skin between cleanses, making grain more apparent.

acne.rationale_plain: Only a few small comedonal-appearing lesions are seen on the cheeks and jaw. No inflammatory clusters or nodules are visible.
possible_causes: Heat, sweat, or occlusive residues can intermittently clog pores.
Cyclical hormonal shifts may trigger small breakouts along the jawline.

citations.title: Review of acne grading scales incl. GAGS

under_eye.rationale_plain: There is clear but moderate under-eye darkening within the lower lids, slightly deeper on the right. No marked hollowing or puffiness is seen.
possible_causes: Natural thinness and pigment of the under-eye skin can create contrast in skin types III–V.
Sleep patterns, eye strain, and seasonal allergies can deepen shadows temporarily.

citations.title: Validated photonumeric scale for infraorbital dark circles

region_summaries.summary_plain: Smooth with mild shine and faint horizontal lines; pores are smaller than on the nose and cheeks. Tone is even.
Calm area with low pore visibility and even color. No prominent lines or redness.
Mild darkening without creasing; texture is smooth and blends into cheek.
Darkening is slightly deeper than the left but still mild–moderate. No significant puffiness.
Mottled pigmentation with moderate pores and grain; overall less pronounced than the right cheek.
Most textured area with more visible pores and mottling; drives overall pore/texture scores.
Highest pore visibility and faint central redness; otherwise even tone.
Even tone and texture with minimal fine lines.
Generally smooth with a few tiny spots; redness is low.
Subtle mottling and occasional small spots; texture remains mild.
Similar to the left with slightly more mottling; texture mild–moderate.

limitations: Only one cheek close-up provided; left cheek microtexture/pore detail inferred from angled views.
Single under-eye close-up; side-to-side under-eye assessment may be slightly less precise.
Minor softness in the nose close-up may slightly reduce pore/texture confidence for that region.
